com.lambdaworks.redis

Class RedisClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lambdaworks.redis.AbstractRedisClient
      • com.lambdaworks.redis.RedisClient

  • public class RedisClient
extends AbstractRedisClient
    A scalable thread-safe Redis client. Multiple threads may share one connection if they avoid blocking and transactional operations such as BLPOP and MULTI/EXEC. RedisClient is an expensive resource. It holds a set of netty's EventLoopGroup's that consist of up to Number of CPU's * 4 threads. Reuse this instance as much as possible.
    Author:
    Will Glozer, Mark Paluch

    • Constructor Detail

      • RedisClient

        protected RedisClient(ClientResources clientResources,
                      RedisURI redisURI)

      • RedisClient

        @Deprecated
public RedisClient()
        Deprecated. Use the factory method create()
        Creates a uri-less RedisClient. You can connect to different Redis servers but you must supply a RedisURI on connecting. Methods without having a RedisURI will fail with a IllegalStateException.

      • RedisClient

        @Deprecated
public RedisClient(String host)
        Deprecated. Use the factory method create(String)
        Create a new client that connects to the supplied host on the default port.
        Parameters:
        host - Server hostname.

      • RedisClient

        @Deprecated
public RedisClient(String host,
                               int port)
        Deprecated. Use the factory method create(RedisURI)
        Create a new client that connects to the supplied host and port. Connection attempts and non-blocking commands will timeout after 60 seconds.
        Parameters:
        host - Server hostname.
        port - Server port.

      • RedisClient

public RedisClient(RedisURI redisURI)
        Deprecated. Use the factory method create(RedisURI)
        Create a new client that connects to the supplied host and port. Connection attempts and non-blocking commands will timeout after 60 seconds.
        Parameters:
        redisURI - Redis URI.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static RedisClient create()
        Creates a uri-less RedisClient with default ClientResources. You can connect to different Redis servers but you must supply a RedisURI on connecting. Methods without having a RedisURI will fail with a IllegalStateException.
        Returns:
        a new instance of RedisClient

      • create

        public static RedisClient create(RedisURI redisURI)
        Create a new client that connects to the supplied uri with default ClientResources. You can connect to different Redis servers but you must supply a RedisURI on connecting.
        Parameters:
        redisURI - the Redis URI, must not be null
        Returns:
        a new instance of RedisClient

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a new instance of RedisClient

      • create

        public static RedisClient create(ClientResources clientResources)
        Creates a uri-less RedisClient with shared ClientResources. You need to shut down the ClientResources upon shutting down your application. You can connect to different Redis servers but you must supply a RedisURI on connecting. Methods without having a RedisURI will fail with a IllegalStateException.
        Parameters:
        clientResources - the client resources, must not be null
        Returns:
        a new instance of RedisClient

        uri - the Redis URI, must not be null
        Returns:

      • pool

        @Deprecated
public RedisConnectionPool<RedisCommands<String,String>> pool()
        Deprecated. Will be removed in future versions. Use ConnectionPoolSupport.
        Creates a connection pool for synchronous connections. 5 max idle connections and 20 max active connections. Please keep in mind to free all collections and close the pool once you do not need it anymore. Requires Apache commons-pool2 dependency.
        Returns:
        a new RedisConnectionPool instance

      • pool

public RedisConnectionPool<RedisCommands<String,String>> pool(int maxIdle,
                                                                          int maxActive)

        Creates a connection pool for synchronous connections. Please keep in mind to free all collections and close the pool once you do not need it anymore. Requires Apache commons-pool2 dependency.
        Parameters:
        maxIdle - max idle connections in pool
        maxActive - max active connections in pool
        Returns:
        a new RedisConnectionPool instance
